sen.j: 藤原 忠房（ふじわら の ただふさ、生年未詳 - 延長 (元号)6年（928年）12月1日 (旧暦)）は、平安時代前期の廷臣、舞楽家、歌人。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tadafusa (birth date unknown-January 14, 929) was a retainer of the Imperial Court, bugakuka (a person who performed traditional Japanese court music accompanied by dancing), and kajin (waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poet) in early Heian Period.

sen.j: 官歴は右兵衛佐、左少将等を歴任し、大和国国司、従四位上・山城国守、右京大夫。
sen.e: The history of his court official positions were, Uhyoe no suke (assistant captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), Sashosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Yamashiro no kuni no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province) with the Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) rank, and Ukyo no daibu (Master of the Western Capital Offices).

sen.j: 一門には雅楽に秀でた者が多く、忠房も琵琶の名手であった父の興嗣よりその才を受け継ぎ、歌舞や管弦の分野において活躍した。
sen.e: There were people who excelled in gagaku (ancient Japanese court dance and music) among the disciples, and Tadafusa himself was the excellent player of biwa (lute) for he received that talent from his father Okitsugu and was active in the fields of utamai (a performance of singing and dancing) and Kangen (gagaku piece without dance).

sen.e: Kocho (Butterflies) and Engiraku that Tadafusa composed the music as Imperial Prince Atsumi choreographed were famous for the representative works of Komagaku music.

sen.j: また歌人としての名声も高く、に開催された「日本紀竟宴和歌」や、の「宇多法皇春日行幸名所和歌」などに出詠するとともに、同じくの「京極御息所歌合」では判者を務めた。
